013package org.apache.juneau.http.header;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConsumerUtils.*;
017
018import java.util.*;
019import java.util.function.*;
020import java.util.stream.*;
021
022import org.apache.http.*;
023import org.apache.http.util.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.http.HttpHeaders;
027import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
029
030/**
031 * A simple list of HTTP headers with various convenience methods.
032 *
033 * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
034 * <p class='bjava'>
035 *    HeaderList <jv>headers</jv> = HeaderList
036 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
037 *       .append(Accept.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"text/xml"</js>))
038 *       .append(<js>"Content-Type"</js>, ()-&gt;<jsm>getDynamicContentTypeFromSomewhere</jsm>());
039 * </p>
040 *
041 * <p>
042 * Convenience creators are provided for creating lists with minimal code:
043 * <p class='bjava'>
044 *    HeaderList <jv>headers</jv> = HeaderList.<jsm>of</jsm>(Accept.<jsf>TEXT_XML</jsf>, ContentType.<jsf>TEXT_XML</jsf>);
045 * </p>
046 *
047 * <p>
048 * Static methods are provided on {@link HttpHeaders} to further simplify creation of header lists.
049 * <p class='bjava'>
050 *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.http.HttpHeaders.*;
051 *
052 *    HeaderList <jv>headers</jv> = <jsm>headerList</jsm>(<jsm>accept</jsm>(<js>"text/xml"</js>), <jsm>contentType</jsm>(<js>"text/xml"</js>));
053 * </p>
054 *
055 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
056 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestCommonBasics">juneau-rest-common Basics</a>
057 * </ul>
058 */
059@FluentSetters
060public class HeaderList extends ControlledArrayList<Header> {
061
062   private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
063
064   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
065   // Static
066   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
067
068   /** Represents no header list in annotations. */
069   public static final class Void extends HeaderList {
070      private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
071   }
072
073   /**
074    * Instantiates a new list.
075    *
076    * @return A new list.
077    */
078   public static HeaderList create() {
079      return new HeaderList();
080   }
081
082   /**
083    * Creates a new {@link HeaderList} initialized with the specified headers.
084    *
085    * @param headers
086    *    The headers to add to the list.
087    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
088    *    <br><jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
089    * @return A new unmodifiable instance, never <jk>null</jk>.
090    */
091   public static HeaderList of(List<Header> headers) {
092      return new HeaderList().append(headers);
093   }
094
095   /**
096    * Creates a new {@link HeaderList} initialized with the specified headers.
097    *
098    * @param headers
099    *    The headers to add to the list.
100    *    <br><jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
101    * @return A new unmodifiable instance, never <jk>null</jk>.
102    */
103   public static HeaderList of(Header...headers) {
104      return new HeaderList().append(headers);
105   }
106
107   /**
108    * Creates a new {@link HeaderList} initialized with the specified name/value pairs.
109    *
110    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
111    * <p class='bjava'>
112    *    HeaderList <jv>headers</jv> = HeaderList.<jsm>ofPairs</jsm>(<js>"Accept"</js>, <js>"text/xml"</js>, <js>"Content-Type"</js>, <js>"text/xml"</js>);
113    * </p>
114    *
115    * @param pairs
116    *    Initial list of pairs.
117    *    <br>Must be an even number of parameters representing key/value pairs.
118    * @throws RuntimeException If odd number of parameters were specified.
119    * @return A new instance.
120    */
121   public static HeaderList ofPairs(String... pairs) {
122      HeaderList x = new HeaderList();
123      if (pairs == null)
124         pairs = new String[0];
125      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
126         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Odd number of parameters passed into HeaderList.ofPairs()");
127      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
128         x.add(BasicHeader.of(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]));
129      return x;
130   }
131
132   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
133   // Instance
134   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
135
136   private VarResolver varResolver;
137   boolean caseSensitive;
138
139   /**
140    * Constructor.
141    */
142   public HeaderList() {
143      super(false);
144   }
145
146   /**
147    * Copy constructor.
148    *
149    * @param copyFrom The bean to copy.
150    */
151   protected HeaderList(HeaderList copyFrom) {
152      super(false, copyFrom);
153      caseSensitive = copyFrom.caseSensitive;
154   }
155
156   /**
157    * Makes a copy of this list.
158    *
159    * @return A new copy of this list.
160    */
161   public HeaderList copy() {
162      return new HeaderList(this);
163   }
164
165   /**
166    * Adds a collection of default headers.
167    *
168    * <p>
169    * Default headers are set if they're not already in the list.
170    *
171    * @param headers The list of default headers.
172    * @return This object.
173    */
174   public HeaderList setDefault(List<Header> headers) {
175      if (headers != null)
176         headers.stream().filter(x -> x != null && ! contains(x.getName())).forEach(this::set);
177      return this;
178   }
179
180   /**
181    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
182    *
183    * @param name The header name.
184    * @param value The header value.
185    * @return This object.
186    */
187   public HeaderList setDefault(String name, Object value) {
188      return setDefault(createPart(name, value));
189   }
190
191   /**
192    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
193    *
194    * @param name The header name.
195    * @param value The header value.
196    * @return This object.
197    */
198   public HeaderList setDefault(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
199      return setDefault(createPart(name, value));
200   }
201
202   /**
203    * Makes a copy of this list of headers and adds a collection of default headers.
204    *
205    * <p>
206    * Default headers are set if they're not already in the list.
207    *
208    * @param headers The list of default headers.
209    * @return A new list, or the same list if the headers were empty.
210    */
211   public HeaderList setDefault(Header...headers) {
212      if (headers != null)
213         setDefault(Arrays.asList(headers));
214      return this;
215   }
216
217   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
218   // Properties
219   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
220
221   /**
222    * Allows header values to contain SVL variables.
223    *
224    * <p>
225    * Resolves variables in header values when using the following methods:
226    * <ul>
227    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Object) append(String,Object)}
228    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Supplier) append(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
229    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Object) prepend(String,Object)}
230    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Supplier) prepend(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
231    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Object) set(String,Object)}
232    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Supplier) set(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
233    * </ul>
234    *
235    * <p>
236    * Uses {@link VarResolver#DEFAULT} to resolve variables.
237    *
238    * @return This object.
239    */
240   public HeaderList resolving() {
241      return resolving(VarResolver.DEFAULT);
242   }
243
244   /**
245    * Allows header values to contain SVL variables.
246    *
247    * <p>
248    * Resolves variables in header values when using the following methods:
249    * <ul>
250    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Object) append(String,Object)}
251    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Supplier) append(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
252    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Object) prepend(String,Object)}
253    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Supplier) prepend(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
254    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Object) set(String,Object)}
255    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Supplier) set(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
256    * </ul>
257    *
258    * @param varResolver The variable resolver to use for resolving variables.
259    * @return This object.
260    */
261   public HeaderList resolving(VarResolver varResolver) {
262      assertModifiable();
263      this.varResolver = varResolver;
264      return this;
265   }
266
267   /**
268    * Specifies that the headers in this list should be treated as case-sensitive.
269    *
270    * <p>
271    * The default behavior is case-insensitive.
272    *
273    * @param value The new value for this setting.
274    * @return This object.
275    */
276   public HeaderList caseSensitive(boolean value) {
277      assertModifiable();
278      caseSensitive = value;
279      return this;
280   }
281
282   /**
283    * Adds the specified header to the end of the headers in this list.
284    *
285    * @param value The header to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
286    * @return This object.
287    */
288   @FluentSetter
289   public HeaderList append(Header value) {
290      if (value != null)
291         add(value);
292      return this;
293   }
294
295   /**
296    * Appends the specified header to the end of this list.
297    *
298    * <p>
299    * The header is added as a {@link BasicHeader}.
300    *
301    * @param name The header name.
302    * @param value The header value.
303    * @return This object.
304    */
305   public HeaderList append(String name, Object value) {
306      return append(createPart(name, value));
307   }
308
309   /**
310    * Appends the specified header to the end of this list using a value supplier.
311    *
312    * <p>
313    * The header is added as a {@link BasicHeader}.
314    *
315    * <p>
316    * Value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link BasicHeader#getValue()}.
317    *
318    * @param name The header name.
319    * @param value The header value supplier.
320    * @return This object.
321    */
322   public HeaderList append(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
323      return append(createPart(name, value));
324   }
325
326   /**
327    * Adds the specified headers to the end of the headers in this list.
328    *
329    * @param values The headers to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
330    * @return This object.
331    */
332   @FluentSetter
333   public HeaderList append(Header...values) {
334      if (values != null)
335            for (Header value : values)
336                if (value != null)
337               append(value);
338      return this;
339   }
340
341   /**
342    * Adds the specified headers to the end of the headers in this list.
343    *
344    * @param values The headers to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
345    * @return This object.
346    */
347   @FluentSetter
348   public HeaderList append(List<Header> values) {
349      if (values != null)
350         values.forEach(this::append);
351      return this;
352   }
353
354   /**
355    * Adds the specified header to the beginning of the headers in this list.
356    *
357    * @param value The header to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
358    * @return This object.
359    */
360   @FluentSetter
361   public HeaderList prepend(Header value) {
362      if (value != null)
363         add(0, value);
364      return this;
365   }
366
367   /**
368    * Appends the specified header to the beginning of this list.
369    *
370    * <p>
371    * The header is added as a {@link BasicHeader}.
372    *
373    * @param name The header name.
374    * @param value The header value.
375    * @return This object.
376    */
377   public HeaderList prepend(String name, Object value) {
378      return prepend(createPart(name, value));
379   }
380
381   /**
382    * Appends the specified header to the beginning of this list using a value supplier.
383    *
384    * <p>
385    * The header is added as a {@link BasicHeader}.
386    *
387    * <p>
388    * Value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link BasicHeader#getValue()}.
389    *
390    * @param name The header name.
391    * @param value The header value supplier.
392    * @return This object.
393    */
394   public HeaderList prepend(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
395      return prepend(createPart(name, value));
396   }
397
398   /**
399    * Adds the specified headers to the beginning of the headers in this list.
400    *
401    * @param values The headers to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
402    * @return This object.
403    */
404   @FluentSetter
405   public HeaderList prepend(Header...values) {
406      if (values != null)
407         prepend(alist(values));
408      return this;
409   }
410
411   /**
412    * Adds the specified headers to the beginning of the headers in this list.
413    *
414    * @param values The headers to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
415    * @return This object.
416    */
417   @FluentSetter
418   public HeaderList prepend(List<Header> values) {
419      if (values != null)
420         addAll(0, values);
421      return this;
422   }
423
424   /**
425    * Removes the specified header from this list.
426    *
427    * @param value The header to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
428    * @return This object.
429    */
430   @FluentSetter
431   public HeaderList remove(Header value) {
432      if (value != null)
433         removeIf(x -> eq(x.getName(), value.getName()) && eq(x.getValue(), value.getValue()));
434      return this;
435   }
436
437   /**
438    * Removes the specified headers from this list.
439    *
440    * @param values The headers to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
441    * @return This object.
442    */
443   @FluentSetter
444   public HeaderList remove(Header...values) {
445      for (Header value : values)
446            remove(value);
447      return this;
448   }
449
450   /**
451    * Removes the specified headers from this list.
452    *
453    * @param values The headers to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
454    * @return This object.
455    */
456   @FluentSetter
457   public HeaderList remove(List<Header> values) {
458      if (values != null)
459         values.forEach(this::remove);
460      return this;
461   }
462
463   /**
464    * Removes the header with the specified name from this list.
465    *
466    * @param name The header name.
467    * @return This object.
468    */
469   @FluentSetter
470   public HeaderList remove(String name) {
471      removeIf(x -> eq(x.getName(), name));
472      return this;
473   }
474
475   /**
476    * Removes the header with the specified name from this list.
477    *
478    * @param names The header name.
479    * @return This object.
480    */
481   @FluentSetter
482   public HeaderList remove(String...names) {
483      if (names != null)
484            for (String name : names)
485                remove(name);
486      return this;
487   }
488
489   /**
490    * Removes all headers from this list.
491    *
492    * @return This object.
493    */
494   public HeaderList removeAll() {
495      clear();
496      return this;
497   }
498
499   /**
500    * Adds or replaces the header(s) with the same name.
501    *
502    * <p>
503    * If no header with the same name is found the given header is added to the end of the list.
504    *
505    * @param value The headers to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
506    * @return This object.
507    */
508   @FluentSetter
509   public HeaderList set(Header value) {
510      if (value != null) {
511         boolean replaced = false;
512         for (int i = 0, j = size(); i < j; i++) {
513            Header x = get(i);
514            if (eq(x.getName(), value.getName())) {
515               if (replaced) {
516                  remove(i);
517                  j--;
518               } else {
519                  set(i, value);
520                  replaced = true;
521               }
522            }
523         }
524
525         if (! replaced)
526            add(value);
527      }
528
529      return this;
530   }
531
532   /**
533    * Adds or replaces the header(s) with the same name.
534    *
535    * <p>
536    * If no header with the same name is found the given header is added to the end of the list.
537    *
538    * @param values The headers to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
539    * @return This object.
540    */
541   @FluentSetter
542   public HeaderList set(Header...values) {
543      if (values != null)
544         set(alist(values));
545      return this;
546   }
547
548   /**
549    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
550    *
551    * @param name The header name.
552    * @param value The header value.
553    * @return This object.
554    */
555   public HeaderList set(String name, Object value) {
556      return set(createPart(name, value));
557   }
558
559   /**
560    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
561    *
562    * @param name The header name.
563    * @param value The header value.
564    * @return This object.
565    */
566   public HeaderList set(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
567      return set(createPart(name, value));
568   }
569
570   /**
571    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
572    *
573    * <p>
574    * If no header with the same name is found the given header is added to the end of the list.
575    *
576    * @param values The headers to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
577    * @return This object.
578    */
579   @FluentSetter
580   public HeaderList set(List<Header> values) {
581
582      if (values != null) {
583         for (Header h : values) {
584            if (h != null) {
585               for (int i2 = 0, j2 = size(); i2 < j2; i2++) {
586                  Header x = get(i2);
587                  if (eq(x.getName(), h.getName())) {
588                     remove(i2);
589                     j2--;
590                  }
591               }
592            }
593         }
594
595         for (Header x : values) {
596            if (x != null) {
597               add(x);
598            }
599         }
600      }
601
602      return this;
603   }
604
605   /**
606    * Gets the first header with the given name.
607    *
608    * <p>
609    * Header name comparison is case insensitive.
610    *
611    * @param name The header name.
612    * @return The first matching header, or {@link Optional#empty()} if not found.
613    */
614   public Optional<Header> getFirst(String name) {
615      for (int i = 0; i < size(); i++) {
616         Header x = get(i);
617         if (eq(x.getName(), name))
618            return Utils.opt(x);
619      }
620      return opte();
621   }
622
623   /**
624    * Gets the last header with the given name.
625    *
626    * <p>
627    * Header name comparison is case insensitive.
628    *
629    * @param name The header name.
630    * @return The last matching header, or {@link Optional#empty()} if not found.
631    */
632   public Optional<Header> getLast(String name) {
633      for (int i = size() - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
634         Header x = get(i);
635         if (eq(x.getName(), name))
636            return Utils.opt(x);
637      }
638      return opte();
639   }
640
641   /**
642    * Gets a header representing all of the header values with the given name.
643    *
644    * <p>
645    * If more that one header with the given name exists the values will be combined with <js>", "</js> as per
646    * <a href='https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-4.2'>RFC 2616 Section 4.2</a>.
647    *
648    * @param name The header name.
649    * @return A header with a condensed value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if no headers by the given name are present
650    */
651   public Optional<Header> get(String name) {
652
653      Header first = null;
654      List<Header> rest = null;
655      for (Header x : this) {
656         if (eq(x.getName(), name)) {
657            if (first == null)
658               first = x;
659            else {
660               if (rest == null)
661                  rest = Utils.list();
662               rest.add(x);
663            }
664         }
665      }
666
667      if (first == null)
668         return opte();
669
670      if (rest == null)
671         return Utils.opt(first);
672
673      CharArrayBuffer sb = new CharArrayBuffer(128);
674      sb.append(first.getValue());
675      for (Header element : rest) {
676         sb.append(", ");
677         sb.append(element.getValue());
678      }
679
680      return Utils.opt(new BasicHeader(name, sb.toString()));
681   }
682
683   /**
684    * Gets a header representing all of the header values with the given name.
685    *
686    * <p>
687    * If more that one header with the given name exists the values will be combined with <js>", "</js> as per
688    * <a href='https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-4.2'>RFC 2616 Section 4.2</a>.
689    *
690    * <p>
691    * The implementation class must have a public constructor taking in one of the following argument lists:
692    * <ul>
693    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>value</jv>)</c>
694    *    <li><c>X(Object <jv>value</jv>)</c>
695    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>name</jv>, String <jv>value</jv>)</c>
696    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>name</jv>, Object <jv>value</jv>)</c>
697    * </ul>
698    *
699    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
700    * <p class='bjava'>
701    *    BasicIntegerHeader <jv>age</jv> = headerList.get(<js>"Age"</js>, BasicIntegerHeader.<jk>class</jk>);
702    * </p>
703    *
704    * @param <T> The header implementation class.
705    * @param name The header name.
706    * @param type The header implementation class.
707    * @return A header with a condensed value or <jk>null</jk> if no headers by the given name are present
708    */
709   public <T> Optional<T> get(String name, Class<T> type) {
710
711      Header first = null;
712      List<Header> rest = null;
713      for (Header x : this) {
714         if (eq(x.getName(), name)) {
715            if (first == null)
716               first = x;
717            else {
718               if (rest == null)
719                  rest = Utils.list();
720               rest.add(x);
721            }
722         }
723      }
724
725      if (first == null)
726         return opte();
727
728      if (rest == null)
729         return Utils.opt(HeaderBeanMeta.of(type).construct(name, first.getValue()));
730
731      CharArrayBuffer sb = new CharArrayBuffer(128);
732      sb.append(first.getValue());
733      for (Header element : rest) {
734         sb.append(", ");
735         sb.append(element.getValue());
736      }
737
738      return Utils.opt(HeaderBeanMeta.of(type).construct(name, sb.toString()));
739   }
740
741   /**
742    * Gets a header representing all of the header values with the given name.
743    *
744    * <p>
745    * Same as {@link #get(String, Class)} but the header name is pulled from the {@link org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.Header#name()} or
746    *    {@link org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.Header#value()} annotations.
747    *
748    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
749    * <p class='bjava'>
750    *    Age <jv>age</jv> = headerList.get(Age.<jk>class</jk>);
751    * </p>
752    *
753    * @param <T> The return type.
754    * @param type The header implementation class.
755    * @return A header with a condensed value or <jk>null</jk> if no headers by the given name are present
756    */
757   public <T> Optional<T> get(Class<T> type) {
758      Utils.assertArgNotNull("type", type);
759
760      String name = HeaderBeanMeta.of(type).getSchema().getName();
761      Utils.assertArg(name != null, "Header name could not be found on bean type ''{0}''", type.getName());
762
763      return get(name, type);
764   }
765
766   /**
767    * Gets all of the headers.
768    *
769    * <p>
770    * The returned array maintains the relative order in which the headers were added.
771    * Each call creates a new array not backed by this list.
772    *
773    * <p>
774    * As a general rule, it's more efficient to use the other methods with consumers to
775    * get headers.
776    *
777    * @return An array containing all headers, never <jk>null</jk>.
778    */
779   public Header[] getAll() {
780      return stream().toArray(Header[]::new);
781   }
782
783   /**
784    * Gets all of the headers with the given name.
785    *
786    * <p>
787    * The returned array maintains the relative order in which the headers were added.
788    * Header name comparison is case insensitive.
789    * Headers with null values are ignored.
790    * Each call creates a new array not backed by this list.
791    *
792    * <p>
793    * As a general rule, it's more efficient to use the other methods with consumers to
794    * get headers.
795    *
796    * @param name The header name.
797    *
798    * @return An array containing all matching headers, never <jk>null</jk>.
799    */
800   public Header[] getAll(String name) {
801      return stream().filter(x -> eq(x.getName(), name)).toArray(Header[]::new);
802   }
803
804   /**
805    * Performs an action on the values for all matching headers in this list.
806    *
807    * @param filter A predicate to apply to each element to determine if it should be included.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
808    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
809    * @return This object.
810    */
811   public HeaderList forEachValue(Predicate<Header> filter, Consumer<String> action) {
812      return forEach(filter, x -> action.accept(x.getValue()));
813   }
814
815   /**
816    * Performs an action on the values of all matching headers in this list.
817    *
818    * @param name The header name.
819    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
820    * @return This object.
821    */
822   public HeaderList forEachValue(String name, Consumer<String> action) {
823      return forEach(name, x -> action.accept(x.getValue()));
824   }
825
826   /**
827    * Returns all the string values for all headers with the specified name.
828    *
829    * @param name The header name.
830    * @return An array containing all values.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
831    */
832   public String[] getValues(String name) {
833      return stream().filter(x -> eq(x.getName(), name)).map(Header::getValue).toArray(String[]::new);
834   }
835
836   /**
837    * Tests if headers with the given name are contained within this list.
838    *
839    * <p>
840    * Header name comparison is case insensitive.
841    *
842    * @param name The header name.
843    * @return <jk>true</jk> if at least one header with the name is present.
844    */
845   public boolean contains(String name) {
846      return stream().anyMatch(x -> eq(x.getName(), name));
847   }
848
849   /**
850    * Returns an iterator over this list of headers.
851    *
852    * @return A new iterator over this list of headers.
853    */
854   public HeaderIterator headerIterator() {
855      return new BasicHeaderIterator(toArray(new Header[0]), null, caseSensitive);
856   }
857
858   /**
859    * Returns an iterator over the headers with a given name in this list.
860    *
861    * @param name The name of the headers over which to iterate, or <jk>null</jk> for all headers
862    *
863    * @return A new iterator over the matching headers in this list.
864    */
865   public HeaderIterator headerIterator(String name) {
866      return new BasicHeaderIterator(getAll(name), name, caseSensitive);
867   }
868
869   /**
870    * Performs an action on all headers with the specified name in this list.
871    *
872    * <p>
873    * This is the preferred method for iterating over headers as it does not involve
874    * creation or copy of lists/arrays.
875    *
876    * @param name The header name.
877    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
878    * @return This object.
879    */
880   public HeaderList forEach(String name, Consumer<Header> action) {
881      return forEach(x -> eq(name, x.getName()), action);
882   }
883
884   /**
885    * Performs an action on all matching headers in this list.
886    *
887    * <p>
888    * This is the preferred method for iterating over headers as it does not involve
889    * creation or copy of lists/arrays.
890    *
891    * @param filter A predicate to apply to each element to determine if it should be included.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
892    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
893    * @return This object.
894    */
895   public HeaderList forEach(Predicate<Header> filter, Consumer<Header> action) {
896      forEach(x -> consume(filter, action, x));
897      return this;
898   }
899
900   /**
901    * Returns a stream of the headers in this list with the specified name.
902    *
903    * <p>
904    * This does not involve a copy of the underlying array of <c>Header</c> objects so should perform well.
905    *
906    * @param name The header name.
907    * @return This object.
908    */
909   public Stream<Header> stream(String name) {
910      return stream().filter(x->eq(name, x.getName()));
911   }
912
913   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
914   // Other methods
915   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
916
917   /**
918    * Creates a new header out of the specified name/value pair.
919    *
920    * @param name The header name.
921    * @param value The header value.
922    * @return A new header.
923    */
924   private Header createPart(String name, Object value) {
925      boolean isResolving = varResolver != null;
926
927      if (value instanceof Supplier<?>) {
928         Supplier<?> value2 = (Supplier<?>)value;
929         return isResolving ? new BasicHeader(name, resolver(value2)) : new BasicHeader(name, value2);
930      }
931      return isResolving ? new BasicHeader(name, resolver(value)) : new BasicHeader(name, value);
932   }
933
934   private Supplier<Object> resolver(Object input) {
935      return ()->varResolver.resolve(Utils.s(unwrap(input)));
936   }
937
938   private Object unwrap(Object o) {
939      while (o instanceof Supplier)
940         o = ((Supplier<?>)o).get();
941      return o;
942   }
943
944   private boolean eq(String s1, String s2) {
945      return caseSensitive ? Utils.eq(s1, s2) : Utils.eqic(s1, s2);
946   }
947
948   @Override /* Object */
949   public String toString() {
950      return "[" + Utils.join(this, ", ") + "]";
951   }
952
953   // <FluentSetters>
954
955   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.collections.ControlledArrayList */
956   public HeaderList setUnmodifiable() {
957      super.setUnmodifiable();
958      return this;
959   }
960
961   // </FluentSetters>
962}
